w:r.w:t: Voice Recognition Algorithms using Mel Frequency Cepstral Coefficient
Digital processing of speech signal and voice recognition algorithm is very important for fast and accurate automatic voice recognition technology
The voice is a signal of infinite information
A direct analysis and synthesizing the complex voice signal is due to too much information contained in the signal
Therefore the digital signal processes such as Feature Extraction and Feature Matching are introduced to represent the voice signal
Several methods such as Liner Predictive Predictive Coding
and etc are evaluated with a view to identify a straight forward and effective method for voice signal

The first one is training sessions
the second one is referred to as operation session or testing
The extraction of the best parametric representation of acoustic signals is an important task to produce a better recognition performance

DTW algorithm is based on Dynamic Programming techniques as describes in
This algorithm is for measuring similarity between two time series which may vary in time or speed
This technique also used to find the optimal alignment between two times series if one time series may be
linearly by stretching or shrinking it along its time axis
This warping between two time series can then be used to find corresponding regions between the two time series or to determine the similarity between the two time series

The warp path distance is a measure of the difference between the two time series after they have been warped together
which is measured by the sum of the distances between each pair of points connected by the vertical lines in Figure 4
two time series that are identical except for loca
lized stretching of the time axis will have DTW distances of zero

the major optimizations to the DTW algo
rithm arise from observations on the nature of good paths through the grid
These are outlined in Sakoe and Chiba
the path will not turn back on itself
andj indexes either stay the same or increase
The path advances one step at a time
andj can only increase by 1 on each step along the path
the path starts at the bottom left and ends at the top right
a good path is unlikely to wander very far from the diagonal
The distance that the path is allowed to wander is the window length
The path should not be too steep or too shallow
This prevents very short sequences matching very long ones

speaking rate and also acoustical noise and variation recording environment via microphone

This paper has discussed two voice recognition algorithms which are important in improving the voice recognition performance
The technique was able to authenticate the particular speaker based on the individual information that was included in the voice signal
The results show that these techniques could used effectively for voice recognition purposes
Several other techniques such as Liner Predictive Predictive Coding
The findings will be presented in future publications
